title: 112_hr2557
content: Establishment of a Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee to advise on interagency coordination and communication efforts to address tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will advise on coordinating efforts with other agencies, ensuring interagency communication, representing diverse scientific viewpoints in public health decisions, and advising on priorities related to Lyme and tick-borne diseases. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will appoint members to the committee. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will be appointed by the Secretary and will include voting members from the scientific community with diverse viewpoints on Lyme and other tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include representatives from tick-borne disease organizations, health care providers experienced in treating tick-borne diseases, and patient representatives diagnosed with tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include representatives from various backgrounds, such as those with experience in treating tick-borne diseases, patient representatives, and members with diverse scientific perspectives. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include ex officio members from Federal agencies overseeing tick-borne disease activities. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include members from various Federal agencies as determined by the Secretary. The Secretary will designate the Assistant Secretary for Health as a co-chairperson, and appointed members will elect a public co-chairperson for a 2-year term. Each member appointed will serve a 4-year term, and vacancies in the Committee membership will be addressed. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee members serve 4-year terms. Vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment, with appointees serving the remainder of the term. Members can continue to serve after their terms expire until successors take office. The Committee holds public meetings at least twice a year, with additional meetings as needed. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee members serve 4-year terms and hold public meetings at least twice a year, with additional meetings as needed. Meetings are conducted as required by law, and reports are submitted annually to the Secretary. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee submits annual reports to the Secretary, detailing the committee's functions, members, activities, and recommendations. $250,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2012 to 2016 for the Department of Health and Human Services. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee is allocated $250,000 annually from 2012 to 2016 for expenses and per diem costs in accordance with the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Voting members cannot be permanent salaried employees.
